KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — European and NATO leaders announced Sunday they will join President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington for talks with President Donald Trump on ending Russia’s war in Ukraine, with the possibility of U.S. security guarantees now on the negotiating table. title: Trump and Putin Discuss Ukraine Peace, Agree on NATO-Style Guarantees
snippets: Special Envoy Steve Witkoff's remarks come just days after President Donald Trump met in Alaska with the Russian president to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.
Putin has agreed to let the U.S. and EU offer Ukraine NATO-style security guarantees, U.S. envoy says, calling it a major step toward a possible peace deal.
Rubio, who is also Trump's national security adviser, said he did not believe issuing new sanctions on Russia would force Putin to accept a ceasefire.

NEW YORK (AP) — Russia’s Vladimir Putin agreed at his summit with President Donald Trump to allow the United States and its European allies to offer Ukraine a security guarantee resembling NATO’s collective defense mandate as part of an eventual deal to end the 3 1/2-year war in Ukraine, speci
titles: White House envoy claims Russia agreed to 'Article 5-like' security guarantees for Ukraine
US envoy says Putin agreed to security protections for Ukraine as part of Trump summit
Putin agreed to let US, Europe offer NATO-style security protections for Ukraine, Trump envoy says
Putin agreed to let US, Europe offer NATO-style security protections for Ukraine, Trump envoy says
summary: During a summit in Alaska, President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed ending the war in Ukraine. Putin agreed to let the U.S. and EU offer Ukraine NATO-style security guarantees, a significant move toward a potential peace deal. However, Trump's national security adviser, Rubio, expressed skepticism about the effectiveness of new sanctions on Russia to promote a ceasefire. This development marks a major step in diplomatic efforts to resolve the 3 1/2-year conflict in Ukraine.

title: Hurricane Erin Downgrades, Lowers Threat to Bahamas, U.S. East Coast
snippets: Heavy rain is still expected across the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, with rainfall of up to 8 inches in some areas.
Erin is the fifth named storm of the Atlantic hurricane season, which runs from June 1 to November 30.

Hurricane Erin was downgraded to a category 3 hurrica
Offshore Hurricane Erin was downgraded to a Category 3 storm early Sunday, as rain lashed Caribbean islands and weather officials warned of possible flash floods and landslides.

Erin barreled through the Atlantic early Sunday, producing heavy winds and rainfall even after being downgraded to a Category 3 hurricane after earlier reaching the top of the five-step, Saffir-Simpson scale.

Hurricane Erin weakened to a Category 3 hurricane Sunday as its outer bands continued to lash the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico with heavy rains and tropical-storm force winds. While Erin’s maximum winds diminished, the storm’s overall size grew and forecasters issued tropical storm war
titles: Hurricane Erin downgraded to Category 3 storm

summary: Hurricane Erin escalated to a Category 5 storm, marking the first hurricane of the Atlantic season, before weakening on Saturday. Although it initially posed a threat to the Bahamas and the U.S. East Coast, the risk of direct impacts is now decreasing. Despite not being expected to make landfall, Erin could still cause strong waves, rip currents, and potential flooding in nearby islands, including Puerto Rico. The hurricane had reached maximum sustained winds of 160 miles per hour.

title: Canada Orders Air Canada Strike to Arbitration, Ends Travel Chaos
snippets: Canada's jobs minister intervenes in the dispute in a bid to preserve "stability and supply chains".
Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu ordered the sides to arbitration. The decision ended an hours-long strike that led the flag carrier to cancel hundreds of flights.
The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will most likely continue for at least a second day.
Air Canada to resume flights today after feds order binding arbitration, ending strike & lockout within 12 hrs. Full operations are expected to take days to normalize.

The union representing Air Canada flight attendants says its workers remain on strike despite a back-to-work order. The Canadian Union of Public Employees says it will challenge an order by the Canada Industrial Relations Board to return to work by 2 p.m. ET. The federal government said Saturday tha
titles: Air Canada flights to resume after union told to end strike

summary: The Canadian government intervened in the Air Canada flight attendants' strike, ordering the airline and its striking employees back to work and into arbitration. This move came after the strike stranded over 100,000 travelers globally. Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu's decision aims to resolve the dispute and has led to the cancellation of hundreds of flights, affecting around 130,000 daily passengers. The full resumption of services is expected to take days, but the arbitration means that 10,000 cabin crew members will return to work, ending the work stoppage that significantly disrupted travel.

summary: Terence Stamp, an Oscar-nominated actor renowned for his roles in the 1960s and his portrayal of General Zod in the "Superman" films, has passed away. His family highlighted his "extraordinary body of work" in their announcement, marking the loss of a significant figure in the film industry.

title: US Restoration Projects Revive Natural Landscapes Nationwide
snippets: In San Francisco Bay, salt ponds created more than a century ago are reverting to marshland. Along the New York and New Jersey coasts, beaches ravaged by Superstorm Sandy underwent extensive restoration. In Alabama, a rebuilt spit of land is shielding a historic town and providing wildlife habitat.
titles: Coastal communities restoring marshes, dunes, reefs to protect against rising seas and storm surges
summary: Across the United States, efforts to restore natural landscapes are underway. In San Francisco Bay, century-old salt ponds are being transformed back into marshland. The coasts of New York and New Jersey, previously damaged by Superstorm Sandy, have seen extensive beach restoration. Meanwhile, in Alabama, a reconstructed spit of land now protects a historic town and serves as a habitat for wildlife. These projects aim to rejuvenate and safeguard natural environments and communities.

title: UN Plastic Pollution Treaty Talks Stall in Geneva

summary: Efforts to create a global treaty on plastics pollution faced setbacks this week during the United Nations Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee meeting in Geneva, Switzerland. Despite extending the meeting's duration, it is expected to end without reaching an agreement.

title: Electric Constant Key to Universe's Structure and Stability
snippets: The force between electrical charges is kind of a big deal—without it, the universe would be a primordial soup and you would not exist. That force is determined by the electric constant.

This fundamental force is essential for the structure and stability of the universe, preventing it from devolving into a chaotic state. Without this force, complex structures, including life itself, would not be possible.
